alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dallas County through 400 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cockrell Hill, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dallas, Irving, Grand Prairie, Duncanville, Cockrell Hill and Mountain Creek Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 421 and 427, and between mile markers 431 and 435. Interstate 20 between mile markers 458 and 462. Interstate 30 between mile markers 35 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
